Administration.text:
Type:
Benzodiazepine
Dosage Forms: CAP 15mg, 30mg
Routes of Administration: Oral
Common Trade Names: Dalmane

Pediatric_Dosing.text: Safety/efficacy not established in pediatric patients

Pregnancy_Rating.text:
Category C
Consider alternatives in pregnancy
Risk of neonatal withdrawal and floppy infant syndrome

Lactation_risk.text: Use alternative or consider short-acting benzodiazepines while breastfeeding

Renal_Dosing.text:
Adult: No adjustment
Pediatric: Not defined

Hepatic_Dosing.text:
Adult: Not defined.
Pediatric: Not defined

Contraindications.text:
Allergy to class/drug
Pregnancy
Avoid abrupt withdrawal with long-term use

Serious.text:
Anaphylaxis
Angioedema
Complex sleep-related behavior
Respiratory depression,
tachycardia
, hypotension,
syncope
Dependency, suicidality
Seizures

Common.text:
Dizziness
, drowsiness, ataxia, confusion,
headache
Disinhibition, irritability
Dystonia
,
dysarthria
Appetite change, menstrual irregulatrity
Incontinence
Rash

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: 2-3h; 40-100h active metabolite
Metabolism: Liver extensively; 3A4 partial substrate
Excretion: Urine

Mechanism_of_Action.text:
Binds to
benzodiazepine
receptors to enhance GABA effects
